reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family

reviews.title: Great Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property isn't a bad value for the money, but it's a bit shabby. Those reviews that say it's wonderful and those that say it sucks are really both wrong - it's smack in the middle. The room we had was clean, but had little midgey bugs in the sink. View was beautiful though and the bed was soft and clean. Overall the place had a 60's Holiday Inn flavor to it. Pool is small and badly in need of repair. Beach was pretty, but I was a bit apprehensive that the rocks may have been more debris than natural. Desk service was shabby and brusk. Room wasn't ready until the specified 4 PM check-in time. That's understandable, but the front desk never bothered to call us when it was ready as they promised. Restaurants were uneven at best. My turkey club for lunch was made from mystery turkey. My seafood dinner medley over linguini was quite good but my wife's fried shrimp were Swanson's worst! The pool bar seemed to be a hangout for some local workmen cooling down at the end of their day's labors. Not being elitist here, guys, but a shower first woulda been nice! We have to share the bar with you even if it is outside... Being close to the airport can be a convenience or a distraction - you choose. Plane's stop at about 10 so we weren't disturbed, but it's a bit of a hoot (this no lie!) being able to easily look right into the hotel lobby from your plane just as it starts to take off!
reviews.title: At least it's close to the airport...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of a week's sailing charter before catching a plane home, so we were just using the facility as a way-station and therefore a bit relaxed about expectations. I don't think I would have been happy staying here for a week's vacation though!
reviews.title: Best hotel we have ever stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I can honestly say that based off of the reviews i had read, I already had very high expectations for this hotel...it exceeded my expectations in every way possible! Everything was just perfect. Our room view was incredible, and the room was sooooo nice and clean. the grounds were spotless, the beach was lovely and not crowded at all...we always got a lounge chair...the restaurant was decent with an incredible view...the bartenders were all wonderful...espeically Tony. Everyone we met here was just so friendly and made us feel like we were 'coming home." We will definitely be back. Also, you only hear the planes taking off for the first few times and then you get used to it. It's not super often anyway. No big deal. It was also nice to walk to/from the airport to save some money. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel! Amazing.
reviews.title: Best Western Emerald Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well if this Hotel/motel rates 6th out of 22 on St Thomas I can only say the others must be pretty abysmal .
reviews.title: VALUE RECEIVED !

reviews.text: Situated on a beautiful beach ,there is no excuse for such a run down second rate establishment posing under the banner of a Best Western Hotel or conversely Best Western are allowing very much second rate Hotels to operate under their name.
reviews.title: Like ants and stains?

reviews.text: P.R.
reviews.title: I was pleasantly surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Brings back memories of the old Sunset Beach near Cape Charles, VA. A time machine back to the 60s. Nothing fancy but, it was clean and relaxing. In some ways, run down. It does take some effort the get the sliding balcony door to move! And the doors below the sink tend to interfere with the mini-fridge door more than anything else. They're about to fall off anyway so, toss them. Coffee maker in the bathroom? Not the ideal location. It uses their filter packets so, don't bother taking your own coffee. No microwave.
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is rather small but not the least bit crowded. And the water couldn't be clearer. So clear that you can watch fish swim by if noone is in the water to scare them. It was a bit on the cool side but, once you jump in, it quickly feels quite comfortable. We were overlooking the bay so, the balcony was dark and cool in the morning. Which was a good thing. For a few hours in the afternoon, it becomes an oven! The balcony is small but just right for the two of us. However, it creates one heck of an echo. Maybe good for someone into karaoke!
reviews.title: just ok !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third year staying at the Best Western Emerald Beach. We love it!! We stay for 10 days. The rooms are large and clean and all the staff is very friendly. Every room has a balcony overlooking the Caribbean. The food is very good. We love the closeness to the airport even though we always rent a car. We like to walk up to the airport in the morning and evening just because it is a nice walk. We like to float in the water and watch the planes take off and land. Don't be worried about plane noise at night. We have never found a problem with any planes after 9:30 or 10:00. They also have a little boutique with almost anything you could need and the prices are very good. Joel the manager will be around to meet you at the Monday night mangers wecoming party. We will be going back again next year for year 4.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and best beach in St. Thomas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from an eight night stay at The Emerald. I was so very sad to leave! I have read some of the reviews that blasted this place but I have to disagree. We had a fabulous time! The rooms were clean and the whole staff was very friendly and sweet.They bent over backwards to meet our needs. The bartenders were the absolute best! No other restaurant on the island made rum punches quite the way Zach aka Jebediah and Craig made them. So very yummy! :-) When you check in the front desk gives you a coupon for two free rum punches. I am not a big drinker as a rule but those rum punches were addicting! LOL When we checked out, we had a couple hours to kill before our flight. The girl at the front desk said we were such "nice guests" that we deserved a coupon for four more rum punches! LOL We took full advantage of the coupon, let me tell you! ;-) We ate at the bar a few times and the food was good so I don't understand why people on here are saying it is awful. I highly recommend the chicken alfredo. My husband liked the wings and burgers, The chicken ceasar salad was just so-so. It could have had a little more chicken in it. But have I mentioned how delicious the rum punches were? ;-) lol
reviews.title: Paradise!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was so relaxing to wake up every morning, make a cup of coffee and just relax on our balcony listening to nothing but the surf and the resident rooster crowing. The hens and their baby chicks came to visit us one morning and we had a resident gecko who came almost every morning to sit on the railing of the balcony and keep us company. ;-) There is a two cup coffee maker in the room so we went to the store and bought our flavored coffee creamer ($4.50 for a small bottle!!) and kept it in the little refrigerator in our room.
reviews.title: Tired - In Need of a face Lift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The taxis into town were a little pricey but it is like that everywhere on the island unless you ride the safari for two dollars. The safari will not bring you right up to the hotel but it will drop you off at the end of the road and you can walk in. My favorite taxi driver was "Leppi" who gave us a card for a discount at one of the jewelry stores on Main St. Needless to say, we saved a nice bit of change when making our purchases in that store! Thank you Leppi! :-)
reviews.title: Great first and last evening in the USVI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach did not get too crowded except for one day when five cruise ships were in port, one of them the Allure, which holds up to 6,000 passengers. Other reviews on here mentioned the lack of the beach towels, and yes, it is true, the hotel did run out of the big beach towels. Make sure you return them to the front desk or you will get charged for them! I made the mistake of putting them in with the regular towels and the maid took them. However, when I realized this I immediately let the front desk know and there was no charge.
reviews.title: Wonderful one night Stay Feb 5th

description: The only 100% beachfront resort on St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands! Tucked into sun-splashed Lindbergh Bay on the Island of St. Thomas, the beautifully appointed Best Western Emerald Beach Resort welcomes guests with the gracious look, style and service of the Virgin Islands' rich heritage. BIG King Size Beds and Spectacular Views from EVERY ROOM! FREE High Speed Internet Access. Flat Screen TVs with Cable TV, 100% Beachfront Views with Balcony and Adjustable air-conditioning. Surrounded by landscaped gardens, cascading waterfalls and lush tropical settings, the Emerald Beach Resort offers a central, convenient location close to the airport, shopping, championship golf and all of St. Thomas's great activities and adventures. With the bounty of land and sea captured in stunning views, it's the perfect place for a memorable vacation. Or an unforgettable wedding, meeting or corporate event.
